objectives: Study the outer planets of the solar system: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
Explore the outer limits of the Sun's magnetic field and the outward flow of solar wind.
Search for the heliopause boundary, the outer limit of the heliosphere.
Continue to provide data on interstellar space.

payloads.name: Imaging Science System (ISS)
payloads.purpose: To capture images of the planets and their moons.

payloads.name: Golden Record
payloads.purpose: A phonograph record containing sounds and images selected to portray the diversity of life and culture on Earth.

outcome.summary: Voyager 2 is the only spacecraft to have visited all four of the outer planets, providing invaluable data and images. It is now exploring interstellar space.
